definition: to press against/to support/to prop up/to resist/to equal/to balance/to make up for/to mortgage/to arrive at/to clap (one's hands) lightly (expressing delight) (Taiwan pr. [zhi3] for this sense)

to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code

sentences.english: Technical development cost can be deducted from the taxable income.
sentences.chinese: 技术开发费抵扣应纳税所得额。

sentences.english: Eliminating tax-deductible mortgage interest would add another $60,000.
sentences.chinese: 废除可抵扣税款的抵押贷款利率，又将增加6万美元。

sentences.english: Deductions for company provided items should be reasonable and legal.
sentences.chinese: 就公司提供物品所作的抵扣应合理合法。

sentences.english: The competent tax authorities shall strengthen their management on the business accounting of tax deduction ledgers .
sentences.chinese: 主管税务机关应加强对税款抵扣台帐核算的管理。

sentences.english: However, they may be tax deductible as ordinary and necessary business expenses.
sentences.chinese: 但是，它们可以作为日常必要的业务支出抵扣税。

sentences.english: Is interest on loans to acquire subsidiaries deductible against HoldCo's profits?
sentences.chinese: 收购子公司贷款利息是否可以抵扣控股公司的利润？

sentences.english: Arrived with your first order volume automatically deducted 10 dollars.
sentences.chinese: 抵用卷在您第一个订单中自动抵扣10美金。

definition: to claim a credit against/tax reduction
to exchange for (sth of equal value or utility)/to use in lieu/to redeem (a coupon etc)/to use to offset (an amount owed etc)
